North Dakota's energy boom transformed the state, bringing workers from across the country. Vouch Mobile helps roughnecks, farmers, and Fargo's growing tech community stay connected across the prairie without paying premium prices.

Network

AT&T Coverage in North Dakota

Vouch Mobile operates on AT&T's award-winning network, providing North Dakota residents with reliable 5G and LTE coverage across the Peace Garden State. With 97% population coverage, you'll stay connected wherever you go.

According to the FCC Broadband Map, AT&T provides extensive wireless coverage throughout North Dakota, including urban centers and many rural areas.

Benefits

Why North Dakota Residents Choose Vouch

North Dakota's average phone bill of $102/month is significant for oil field and farm workers—Vouch cuts that by 71%.

Whether you're working the Bakken oil fields, farming near Minot, or coding in Fargo, you need reliable coverage.

No credit check means NDSU students, new North Dakota residents, and energy workers can sign up instantly.

AT&T's network covers North Dakota's cities and major corridors, including Fargo, Bismarck, and Grand Forks.

    FAQ

    North Dakota Coverage Questions

    Everything you need to know about Vouch Mobile in North Dakota

    Yes! Vouch Mobile provides 97% population coverage across North Dakota using AT&T's network. From Fargo to Bismarck, Grand Forks to Minot, you'll have reliable LTE service throughout the Peace Garden State.

    Vouch Mobile operates on AT&T's network in North Dakota. AT&T covers the state's cities, major highways, and many oil field areas.

    Vouch Mobile costs $30/month for unlimited talk, text, and data—no matter where you live in North Dakota. The average North Dakotan pays $102/month for phone service, so you could save over $864 per year by switching to Vouch.

    No credit check required. Whether you're an NDSU student, a new North Dakota resident, or rebuilding your credit, you can sign up for Vouch Mobile instantly.

    Switching is easy: check that your phone is unlocked, order a free Vouch SIM card shipped to your North Dakota address, then activate online in minutes. You can keep your existing phone number—we'll handle the port.

    Coverage is available in Williston and surrounding oil field communities. Remote well sites may have limited coverage, but towns have service.

    Yes! The Fargo-Moorhead metro has excellent coverage throughout, including NDSU campus and downtown Fargo.

    Coverage is available in most towns and along major highways. Very remote prairie and ranch areas may have limited coverage.
